Message.Title: Cypress pypress: it doesnt matter the story
Message.Msg: Plain and simple, global and US finance are a fvck in impending tainwreck of an easy worthless cabbage train without brakes... Ben iz your conductor, and sheila and tim bailed... The bla bla bla media iz just an after the fact story that at best excellerates sheeple's perception in one direction or another, constantly seeking credibility and validation.... It doesnt matter the story, transferring wealth from the many to the few by printing money simply doesnt work while the many go broke against high inflation and low savingz interest , sheiiiittty job prospects, and erroded corporate bene's with chisled "entitlements". This iz happening while the few such az bezos and hastingz transform their worthless free stok in amzn and nflx to bernanke bux and hard assets such az land, gold, and ammo.... This arshole setup could have been fixed in 2008, but bernanke and co chose to save it and make it worse.

Message.Msg: Although the class action suit is interesting... Has Amazon been using its 3P sellers to mask financial stress by overextending days payable on those with limited capacity to fight back? Nonetheless, it would be fun to see the little guys get some redress and have Amazon figuring out the cash issue elsewhere...

Topic.Title: time to buy my friends !

Message.Msg: Later in that same letter Buffett adds that… “Occasionally, though, even very conservative estimates about the future…reveal that the price quoted is startlingly low in relation to value.” What Amazon’s done as a business is also impressive in many ways. It’s not hard to understand why so many think highly of the company and its future prospects. Yet, I will always find figuring out the valuation of the company — even within a very wide range — to be incredibly difficult.* Some investors are willing to pay a huge premiums for the possibility that significantly higher earnings power will someday materialize. Some of those same investors will quickly lose interest once there is a lack of exciting growth prospects. (Even if real persistent earnings is actually, after a long wait, now finally being demonstrated. So literally willing to pay more for the promise of future cash flow than when it actually materializes.)

Message.Title: Banrkupt banks with even more financial tricks
Message.Msg: I can't believe the whole Fed and financial system is working to keep these banks alive instead of cleaning up the mess. "The 300-page report was just an appetizer for Friday’s hearing, when JPMorgan executives were grilled under oath and former CFO Douglas Braunstein essentially admitted the bank kept regulators in the dark about its mounting losses. “Things went terribly wrong,” testified Ina Drew, who ran the firm’s Chief Investment Office before stepping down under pressure after the London Whale losses first surfaced last spring. The Senate report and subsequent testimony could expose JPMorgan to additional litigation risk, which is a problem for a number of big banks these days. "
